{{cpp/numeric/valarray/title|cshift}}
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/navbar}}
{{ddcl|
valarray&lt;T&gt; cshift( int count ) const;
}}

Returns a new valarray of the same size with elements whose positions are shifted circularly by {{c|count}} elements.

A non-negative value of {{c|count}} shifts the elements circularly left {{c|count}} places and a negative value of {{c|count}} shifts the elements circularly right {{c|-count}} places.

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|count|number of positions to shift the elements by}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
The resulting valarray with circularly shifted elements.

===Notes===
{{cpp/numeric/valarray/notes ret}}

===Example===
{{example
|
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;valarray&gt;

int main()
{
    std::valarray&lt;int&gt; v{1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8};
    
    for (auto const&amp; val : v)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; val &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
    
    std::valarray&lt;int&gt; v2 = v.cshift(2);
    
    for (auto const&amp; val : v2)
        std::cout &lt;&lt; val &lt;&lt; ' ';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 
3 4 5 6 7 8 1 2
}}
